ygData.subject: Re: Clan Singapura?
ygData.msgSnippet: Err no pls, this guild is more of an informal gang for local kakis, not those official guilds like in UO.  It s just an recognition for local players and also
ygData.messageBody:
Err no pls, this guild is more of an informal gang for local kakis, not
those official guilds like in UO. It's just an recognition for local
players and also make it easy for new local players to identify us. tDw in
UO already make me head-big liao, I dun wanna hold another guildmaster =P
Instead I'm now sourcing for good trust-worthy member in UO to transfer
guildmaster post to them so that I can have more time for EQ, hehe.

Anyname also k lah, but best is one with can let pple easily identify us as
Singaporeans.

Ziltus

On Wednesday, May 26, 1999 12:03 AM, Gary Qui Hong Loong
[SMTP:kanglun@...] wrote:
> From: "Gary Qui Hong Loong" <kanglun@...>
>
> uhm I delcine the position of Guild Master. I'm not good enough on
guild
> matters. LWK would be the better choice ^_^

> > >
> > >Ever though of setting a gang for S'pore kakis? I think with quite a
few
> > >of us in Innoruuk, it's time for us to setup a local gang. This is
not a
> > >guild like UO, just an informal group for local players only. Of coz
we
> > >still need a guild master to talk to game GM to setup a 'guild' - I
> > >recommend the oldest (or highest lvl) EQ players in S'pore to hold the
> > >position of 'guildmaster'. Again I must stress, this is just an
informal
> > >gang - no guild activities or structure, but just a recognition for
local
> > >players, and make it easy for other new local players to identify us.
> Thus
> > >we must think of a 'localized' name, eg Clan Singapura, one look we
know
> > >it's a S'pore gang liao. Feasible?
> > >
> > >Ziltus
> > >
